body.p:
To his Excellency
B. McGoffin Governor of Ky

Your petitioner Charles Mytinger Sen. will state to your excellency, that he has been in bad health for a number of years, and very poor and unable to work for a living he a short time past opened a small grocery in the City of Maysville, and for the last three months kept a small portion of whisky to sell to a few friends. who visited his house, as it was not his object to keep a drinking house to make money to the sale of spiritious liquors

Under the state of case has been taken up by the Mayor of the City of Maysville and fined fifty dollars and costs. He is poor very poor and not able to pay the fine. and he petitions your Excelleny to remit the whole fine --
His poverty drove him to the sale of the small quantity of liquor, and he pledge himself to cease the sale of spirits in his grocey.

We are acquainted with Charles Mytinger. He is in very bad health and poor and we petition your Excellency to grant his petition and to remit his fine of $10 -- assessed by the Mayor of Maysville. August 13th 1861

Francis T Hord
Keith Berry
R H Baldwin
H. Taylor.
Robt A Cochran
Emery Whitaker
J. R. Paddock
H. Reed
